data.title: Emporia State University
data.meta_description: The Emporia State University Orchestras strive to expand appreciation of classical music in our community, educate youth about the orchestra and create a space for musicians to perform and develop musicianship.
data.text:
The Emporia Symphony Orchestra is an ensemble made up of 50-65 community and university musicians that performs four to five concerts per year on campus at Albert Taylor Hall as well as off-campus in various venues.

Scholarships are available to both majors and non-majors for participation and awarded based on individual auditions.

The Emporia Symphony Orchestra plays the standard orchestra repertoire ranging from Baroque to contemporary.

Symphony Orchestra is a 1-credit hour class.

Course Name: Orchestra

Course Number: MU 319 A/MU 630 A

Rehearsals: M 7:00-9:30 p.m.

Room Number: Beach Hall 134

The Chamber Orchestra is primarily a string ensemble consisting of 20-35 students with additional woodwind, brass and percussion players depending on the demands of the repertoire.

The Chamber Orchestra performs four to eight concerts per year on campus in Heath Recital Hall as well as off-campus in various venues.

Scholarships are available to both majors and non-majors for participation and awarded based on individual auditions.

The Chamber Orchestra covers a broad range of music from Baroque to contemporary.

The Chamber Orchestra is a 1-credit hour class.

Course Name: Chamber Music - Chamber Orchestra

Course Number: MU 391 E/691 E

Rehearsals: MTWR 2:00-2:50 p.m.

Room Number: Beach Hall 132
